Posilstvo najstnice še vedno razburja
Nevladna hrvaška organizacija ogorčena nad pisanjem o zlorabljeni deklici. Nad njo so se znašali kar leto dni, zaupala se je šolskemu psihologu.
02 Nov 2019, 21:03 by G. S.



»Zakon ni dovolj,« je jasna Maja Mamula. FOTO: Igor Mandic



Takole možično so se Hrvati udeležili protestnega shoda z geslom Pravica za deklice.


ZAGREB – Zgodba zdaj 16-letne deklice iz Zadra, ki naj bi jo več kot leto spolno zlorabljala skupina sedmih fantov, med katerimi sta dva mladoletna, nikakor ne pojenja. Po tistem, ko preiskovalni sodnik zoper domnevne storilce ni odredil pripora, so pod geslom Pravica za deklice po večjih mestih na Hrvaškem pred dnevi potekali protesti v podporo žrtvam spolnega nasilja, ki od pristojnih institucij ne dobijo primerne zaščite in podpore.


Takole možično so se Hrvati udeležili protestnega shoda z geslom Pravica za deklice.

Medtem je sodišče v Zadru sicer spremenilo svojo odločitev in priprlo peterico, dva mladoletna storilca pa naj bi bila na prostosti.Deklica naj bi bila žrtev spolnega nasilja kar eno leto, storilci pa naj bi jo nadlegovali tudi na javnih mestih. Izbruhnilo naj bi po tistem, ko se je sicer odlična učenka sprla z enim od profesorjev, ta pa jo je zaradi problematičnega vedenja poslal k psihologu, pri katerem pa je začelo iz nje vreti vse hudo, kar naj bi se ji dogajalo. Psiholog je ocenil, da je deklica, takrat stara 15 let, verjetno žrtev spolne zlorabe, o čemer je obvestil pristojni CSD in policijo. 
Krivdo prevalili na žrtev
Kot nam je zaupala Maja Mamula, vodja nevladne organizacije Ženska soba – Center za seksualne pravice iz Zagreba, ena od organizatork protesta, je v sredo razburila izdaja Hrvatskega tjednika z naslovnico, na kateri so fotografije vseh vpletenih, in z naslovom Primer posilstva pri Zadru izmišljen. V prispevku avtor razglablja o tem, da ni nobenih dokazov, da se je očitano res zgodilo, vso krivdo pa vali na žrtev, ki je po naših neuradnih informacijah povsem zlomljena in menda na psihiatriji.
7storilcev naj bi nad 15-letnico leto dni izvajalo spolno nasilje.
»Včeraj smo poskušali preprečiti distribucijo tednika, tudi prek policije, vendar neuspešno. Mislim, da nam ne preostane drugega, kot da zoper tednik podamo kazensko ovadbo kar mi, kar bi sicer moralo storiti državno tožilstvo,« pravi Mamulova, ki ima kot psihologinja že več kot več 25 let izkušenj dela z žrtvami spolnih zlorab. Poudarja, da je edina oseba, ki je odgovorna za spolno nasilje, storilec kaznivega dejanja, medtem ko se poskuša v tem primeru, kot je razbrati iz članka, krivdo za dejanja pripisati žrtvi. »Dolžnost pristojnih institucij je, da storilce procesuira, tako pa se v naši družbi žrtvam še vedno pripisuje odgovornost za dejanja, ki so jih storili drugi,« pravi Mamulatova. Čeprav se morda zdi, da bi žrtev morala biti brezgrešna, torej s samimi pozitivnimi lastnostmi, to v praksi ne drži.Zakon ni dovoljČe se v Sloveniji stvari glede žrtev kaznivih dejanj počasi izboljšujejo – razveseljuje dejstvo, da je predlog Nove Slovenije, da kazniva dejanja s področja spolnih zlorab ne bi nikoli zastarala, na prvi javni obravnavi konec septembra v državnem zboru podprlo 75 poslancev brez glasu proti; 20. oktobra pa je začela veljati novela zakona o kazenskem postopku, ki na precej področjih izboljšuje položaj žrtev, vsaj na papirju, pa so predstavnice Ženske sobe včeraj pred hrvaško vlado prvič zahtevale konkretne spremembe na področju spolnega nasilja. »Zakon ni dovolj, potrebovali bi spremembe v razmišljanju družbe, pa vsaj še tri podobne organizacije, da bi lahko pomagale žrtvam nasilja,« nam je zaupala Maja Mamula iz hrvaške Ženske sobe.       »Lahko imamo žrtve s težkim značajem, lahko je impulzivna,neprilagojena, lahko ima sumljivo preteklost, pa vendar je žrtev. Med njo in storilcem ne more biti enačaja. Ženske ne postanejo žrtve kaznivih dejanj po svoji volji, niso hotele biti posiljene,« je odločna Maja Mamula.

The rape of a teenager still upsets her
A non-governmental Croatian organization outraged at writing about an abused girl. They were above her for a year, she trusted a school psychologist.
02 Nov 2019, 21:03 by G.S.



"Law is not enough," Maja Mamula is clear. PHOTO: Igor Mandic



This is how the Croats might have attended a protest rally with the motto Right for Girls.


ZAGREB - The story of a now 16-year-old girl from Zadar, who was allegedly sexually abused by a group of seven boys, two of whom are minors, has no effect on her. After the investigating judge did not order custody of the alleged perpetrators, protests in support of victims of sexual violence, who did not receive adequate protection and support from competent institutions, took place days ago under the motto Right for girls in major cities in Croatia.


This is how the Croats might have attended a protest rally with the motto Right for Girls.

Meanwhile, a court in Zadar reversed its decision and detained five of them, and two juvenile offenders are expected to be at large. The girl was allegedly a victim of sexual violence for one year, and the perpetrators were also harassed in public places. It should have erupted after another excellent student quarreled with one of the professors, who sent her to a psychologist for problematic behavior, at which point everything that was happening to her began to boil. The psychologist estimated that the girl, 15 years old at the time, was likely a victim of sexual abuse, and informed the responsible CSD and police.
Blame the victim on the victim
As Maja Mamula, the head of the non-governmental organization Women's Room - Center for Sexual Rights in Zagreb, one of the organizers of the protest, told us on Wednesday, she was upset by the edition of the Croatian weekly with a cover, with photos of everyone involved, and the subject of Rape Case in Zadar. . The author argues in the article that there is no evidence that the alleged thing really happened, but all the blame goes to the victim, who according to our unofficial information is completely broken and allegedly in psychiatry.
7-year-olds are expected to commit sexual violence over the age of 15.
“Yesterday we tried to prevent the weekly distribution, even through the police, but to no avail. I think we have nothing left but to file a criminal complaint against us, which is what the state prosecutor's office should do, "says Mamulova, who as a psychologist has more than 25 years of experience working with victims of sexual abuse. He points out that the only person responsible for sexual violence is the perpetrator of the crime, while in this case, as the article shows, the blame for the acts is attributed to the victim. "It is the responsibility of the competent institutions to prosecute the perpetrators, so that in our society, victims are still being held accountable for the acts committed by others," says Mamulatova. Although it may seem that the victim should be sinless, that is, with positive attributes, this is not true in practice. The law is not enoughWhen things are slowly improving in Slovenia for victims of crime - it is gratifying to note that Nova Slovenija's proposal is that crimes would never be time-barred in the area of sexual abuse, endorsed 75 non-voting members of parliament at the first public hearing in late September; On 20 October, however, amendments to the Criminal Procedure Act came into force, improving the position of victims in many areas, at least on paper, for the first time, before the Croatian government, for the first time before the Croatian government called for concrete changes in the field of sexual violence. "The law is not enough, we need changes in the thinking of the society, and at least three other similar organizations to help victims of violence," Maja Mamula of the Croatian Women's Room confided in us. "We can have victims of a severe nature, it can be impulsive, unadapted, it can have a suspicious past, but it is a victim. There can be no equation between her and the perpetrator. Women do not become victims of crime of their own volition, they did not want to be raped, "Maja Mamula is determined.
